comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: This pic appears to have been taken following the 1896 flood. Here we see the second permanent Victoria Bridge under construction, meeting the temporary wooden bridge (erected after the 1893 flood) mid stream. Here's an 1896 Brisbane Courier article - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article20445256 ; and pic from the SLQ - www.flickr.com/photos/statelibraryqueensland/4583505396/ ...as can be seen, the action is on the upstream side of the bridge...in the background we see South Brisbane

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Thank you for your research efforts quaymody. Our records have been updated with the correct details. This link also seems to confirm that this picture depicts the clean up after the 1896 flood (bit.ly/NWZRUd)
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
